RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia da Computao - ETEP Faculdades (2011). Tem experincia na rea de eltrica, eletrnica e anlise de sistema. Foi bolsista FAPESP no projeto 08/56711-4 no perodo 01/02/2012 at 30/11/2013. Atualmente bolsista do CNPq. Profissional dedicado com bom envolvimento em trabalho de equipe, trabalho sobre presso e sempre buscando as oportunidades de liderana.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Graduated in Computer Engineering - ETEP Colleges (2011). Has experience in the area of electrical, electronic and system analysis. He was a fellow FAPESP project 08/56711-4 the period 01/02/2012 to 30/11/2013. He is currently sponsored by CNPq. Dedicated professional with good involvement in teamwork, working under pressure and always seeking opportunities for leadership.

GRADUACAO.NOME-DO-ORIENTADOR: Josemar Monteiro Silva e Dr. Kleber Pinheiro Naccarato

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-UNIDADE: Centro de Previso de Tempo e Estudos Climticos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Impacto das mudanas climticas sobre a incidncia de descargas atmosfricas no Brasil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto Temtico - FAPESP - 08/56711-4 Este projeto tem como objetivo a deteco de sinais de variabilidade, relacionados a mudanas climticas, na incidncia e caractersticas das descargas atmosfricas registradas no Brasil na ltima dcada, e o aperfeioamento das atuais tcnicas de observao de raios no estado de So Paulo, de modo a permitir um melhor monitoramento destas variabilidades para o futuro. Trs principais atividades esto previstas: analisar os bancos de dados de descargas atmosfricas nuvem-solo da Rede Brasileira de Deteco de Descargas Atmosfricas (BrasilDAT) na regio sudeste desde 1999, e de descargas atmosfricas de todos os tipos obtido pelo sensor Lightning Imaging Sensor (LIS) no Brasil desde 1998, complementados por dados de dias de tempestade; aperfeioar no estado de So Paulo a performance da BrasilDat e implantar no estado uma rede de monitoramento de descargas intra-nuvem, de modo a permitir melhorar e ampliar as informaes disponveis para futuros estudos; realizar campanhas de observao com cmaras de alta velocidade de modo a avaliar o desempenho da nova configurao da BrasilDat e da nova rede de monitoramento de descargas intra-nuvem no estado de So Paulo. O impacto das mudanas climticas sobre a incidncia de descargas atmosfricas um dos grandes desafios das pesquisas na rea de eletricidade atmosfrica, conforme evidenciado no ltimo relatrio do IPCC. Os resultados do projeto iro contribuir no entendimento de causas e tendncias climticas nas escalas regional e local, auxiliando na implantao de polticas pblicas para minimizao dos impactos em vidas e prejuzos decorrentes do fenmeno e colaborar no futuro com os objetivos do Programa de Mudanas Climticas recm lanado pela FAPESP..
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Thematic Project - FAPESP - 08/56711-4 This project aims to detect signs of variability related to climate change, the incidence and characteristics of lightning recorded in Brazil in the last decade, and the improvement of current techniques of observation ray in the state of So Paulo in order to allow better monitoring of these variabilities for the future. Three main activities are planned: analyze databases lightning cloud-to-ground of the Brazilian Lightning Detection (BrasilDAT) in the southeast since 1999, and lightning all types obtained by the sensor Lightning Imaging Sensor (LIS ) in Brazil since 1998, supplemented by data from stormy days; improve the state of So Paulo's performance BrasilDat and deploy a network of state monitoring of intra-cloud discharges, to allow improve and expand the information available for future studies; observation campaigns with high-speed cameras in order to evaluate the performance of new configuration BrasilDat and new network monitoring intra-cloud discharges in the state of So Paulo. The impact of climate change on the incidence of lightning is one of the major challenges of research in atmospheric electricity, as evidenced in the last IPCC report. The results of the project will contribute to the understanding of causes and climate trends in regional and local scales, assisting in the implementation of public policies to minimize impacts on lives and damages arising out of the phenomenon and to collaborate in the future with the objectives of the Climate Change Program recently launched FAPESP ..
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Impacto das mudanas climticas sobre a incidncia de descargas atmosfricas no Brasil

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

AREA-DE-ATUACAO.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Automao Eletrnica de Processos Eltricos e Industriais

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: High-speed video and electromagnetic analysis of two natural bipolar cloud-to-ground lightning flashes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: High-speed video records of two bipolar cloud-to-ground flashes were analyzed in detail. They both began with a single positive return stroke that was followed by more than one subsequent weak negative stroke. Due to the elevated cloud base height of its parent thunderstorm, the preparatory processes of each subsequent negative stroke were documented optically below cloud base. In the first event (Case 1) it was observed that all four subsequent negative strokes were initiated by recoil leaders that retraced one horizontal channel segment previously ionized by the positive leader. Those recoil leaders connected to the original vertical channel segment and propagated toward ground, producing four subsequent strokes that had the same ground contact point as the original positive discharge. The second event (Case 2), in contrast, presented 15 subsequent strokes that were initiated by recoil leaders that did not reach the original channel of the positive stroke. They diverged vertically toward ground, making contact approximately 11 km away from the original positive strike point. These results constitute the first optical evidence that both single- and multiple-channel bipolar flashes occur as a consequence of recoil leader activity in the branches of the initial positive return stroke. For both events their total channel length increased continuously at a rate of the order of 104 m s−1, comparable to speeds reported for typical positive leaders.

FORMACAO-COMPLEMENTAR-CURSO-DE-CURTA-DUR.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Seanson Consultoria e Treinamento em Informtica

FORMACAO-COMPLEMENTAR-CURSO-DE-CURTA-DUR.NOME-CURSO: PIC18 usando MPLAB, com comunicao TCP/IP, serial
